result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diamond Kiara Marshall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Diamond Kiara Marshall appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Diamond Kiara Marshall.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defendant is eligible for a tier 1 offer and parties request a status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Diamond Kiara Marshall appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Diamond Kiara Marshall.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with OLV,JMK and JJZ.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/24/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Diamond Kiara Marshall in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/22/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on September 22, 2022 at 1:00 PM.  jm
